Comments_List: learned a lot about SDGs and situation analyses in my cluster country groups

Knowledge: SDS, UN negotiating, and establishing a framework, 
Skills; reading, writing a report, analyzing data insights: Child health has multi-disciplinary aspects and needs a multi-sectoral approach to developing solutions.
small size of class was a big plus and the trip to the UN was great

Some strengths include discussion among classmates, interesting slides and the data report sheets that we read. 

Some weakness include lecturing too much, Dr.A, not including personal examples.
Organization of this course was confusing, mostly in regards to the succession of lecture topics and the assignment due dates and expectations.

Yes, definitely! If you are interested in Global health/ African Studies of any kind, it's important to look at how we can approach health and development via policy and collaboration. Dr.Alipui is an insightful professor that has experience working with UNICEF and adds a lot of details that are important to understanding the situation of children in Africa. Africa is a complex, intricate and absolutely important to understand as we move into the future, so take it and gain some new insights!
